Key Match Events: Indian bowlers, led by Hardik Pandya, Jasprit Bumrah, and Arshdeep Singh, bundled out Ireland for a paltry 96.
Axar Patel took a catch to dismiss Barry McCarthy.
Post-Match Reflections: Former England captain Michael Vaughan called the pitch at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium a 'sub-standard surface.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch had plenty of bounce and seam, which assisted the pacers.
This was the second match in a row in New York where a team was bowled out for a total less than 100.
India will play their next two matches at this venue against Pakistan on June 9 and against co-hosts USA on June 12.
